dialogue.raw_text: : Aerial dialogue in CAPS is UHF radio; plane to plane, plane to carrier. Aerial dialogue in small case is ICS; an inter-cockpit system; a live mike, heard by pilot and RIO only. TG1   REVISED  04APR85    .
dialogue.name: dialogue

result.heading: THE PACIFIC IS ANYTHING BUT WINDS HOWL
SOMETHING DROPS DOWN OUT OF THE NIGHT A ROAR
A SHOWER OF SPARKS, A SCREECH OF RUBBER AND METAL

direction.raw_text: .  EXT. NIGHT. - THE PACIFIC IS ANYTHING BUT WINDS HOWL. Rain drives horizontal. The sea surges up, nearly to the flight deck of the Aircraft Carrier USS Kitty Hawk. The carrier plunges, driving its bow into a wall of grey water. The deck pitches forward and back, rolls left to right, and yaws in a corkscrew motion. The entire 93,000 ton behemoth rises and falls in the TYPHOON-DRIVEN SWELL. 2.  SOMETHING DROPS DOWN OUT OF THE NIGHT A ROAR. Silver wings flash by, a cockpit, fiery jet exhausts. A forty ton monster drops at 120 knots into an area the size of a tennis court in a CONTROLLED CRASH. 2A.  A SHOWER OF SPARKS, A SCREECH OF RUBBER AND METAL as the gear hits the deck. The hook catches the 3 wire and the F-14 TOMCAT is slammed to a halt. It's the scariest thing you've ever seen, the most dangerous maneuver in aviation and just another day at the office for a Naval Aviator.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - THE CARS - RIDE ME HIGH 3.  FLIGHT DECK - THE LANDING SIGNAL OFFICER - (LSO) Leans almost horizontal into the winds. He holds the pickle, controlling the landing lights and speaks into a mike. His calm, professional commands belie the extreme conditions.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...DON'T CLIMB...
direction.name: direction

result.heading: TITLES OVER HARD DRIVING ROCK AND ROLL
ANOTHER TOMCAT FLIES OVER THE RAMP

direction.raw_text: .  ANOTHER TOMCAT FLIES OVER THE RAMP It slams in. The pilot hits full power, catches the wire, slams to a stop, cuts his engines.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .  OMITTED 6.  AIR OPS - BELOW DECK Lots of scopes and electronic gear. The CARRIER CONTROL APPROACH OFFICER (CCA) watches a blip on radar, reaches for his mike key.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .  EXT. THE TWILIGHT'S LAST GLEAMING - (AERIAL) We float like gods, above the storm, above the cloud cover, looking down. From overhead, a probe slides into frame, then a graceful nose. The cockpit sides by, Pilot, then Radar Intercept Officer (RIO) barely illuminated by the orange glow of their instruments. The fuselage gracefully swells to two enormous air intakes, then variable angle wings, swept back for high speed flight. Twin tailbooms cant outward, horizontal stabilizers make constant adjustments. Enormous twin jet exhaust ports glow red in the moonlight.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: WIND WHISTLE, JET ENGINE SOUNDS, RADIO STATIC

direction.raw_text: .  INT. COCKPIT - (AERIAL) We become aware of WIND WHISTLE, JET ENGINE SOUNDS, RADIO STATIC. The pilot, COUGAR, is calm, steady. The Radar Intercept Officer in the backseat, GOOSE, is a wildman, always an edge of humor in his voice. A UHF transmission breaks in..
direction.name: direction

WALTER MERLIN; WIZARD.

The bottom screen shows a radar sweep. Wedged between the instruments is a snapshot of a pretty young woman with a 2 month-old baby.

direction.raw_text: .  EXT. SKY Closing at 900 knots, The MiG is a speck, then a flash and a ROAR, a knife-edge pass at 300 feet. It rockets past his left wing tip and disappears. Cougar kicks rudder, whips the stick, screams into a tight turning roll and dives after him. He slams the throttle forward to ZONE 5 AFTERBURNER. 13.  EXT. - MAVERICK'S F-14 Maverick sees a SECOND MiG drop from above onto Cougar's tail.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . I'M ON HIS. Maverick swings after him, lights it. 13A.  ALL FOUR JETS SCREAM DOWN IN A POWER DIVE. They punch through cloud cover into the soup.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: ALL FOUR JETS SCREAM DOWN IN A POWER DIVE

direction.raw_text: . TRY A HIGH G ROLL UNDERNEATH. BREAK OUT THE BOTTOM. Anger gives way to discipline. Cougar's Tomcat breaks left, dives into dense cloud. MiG TWO still follows.

MAVERICK HE'S STILL ON YOU, COUGAR

direction.raw_text: .  EXT. COUGAR - IN THE CLOUDS Still hears the tone, BLIPBLIPBLIP...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . I KNOW. He rolls over into wild evasive maneuvers, finally breaks lock. 16.  INT. MIG Breaks out of cloud, looks around, startled.  There is nothing, no F-14. He scans the sky frantically, while rolling the aircraft. ...Suddenly, he feels a presence. He looks straight up and behind him. A few feet away, a TOMCAT slides into position canopy to canopy, an incredible feat of flying. Maverick and Wizard stare at him. Maverick slides even closer, canopies nearly touching. The MiG pilot acknowledges them with a weak wave. Maverick stares for a moment, then flips him the bird. The MiG pushes negative G, hard down and away. He heads for the deck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's running for it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ah, the thrill of victory and the agony of defeat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Speaking of feet, fuel's down to 4.0.  We're gonna get them wet unless we find a Sonoco station.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .  I'M GETTING HUNGRY, LET'S HEAD FOR THE BARN. ...COUGAR, WHERE ARE YOU?
direction.name: direction

MAVERICK YOU'RE STRAIGHT AND LEVEL, COUGAR

direction.raw_text: .  EXT. FLIGHT DECK All eyes are on what they can see of the approach of the two planes. Maverick drops him off at the pattern and circles. The LSO watches the approach. The Tomcat drops a wing, straightens, drops the wing, straightens ... the approach of a pilot experiencing vertigo as Cougar tries to satisfy his inner ear.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...YOUR WINGS... EASY... YOU'RE SETTLING....FLY THE BALL. A wind shear just off the ramp drives the plane suddenly down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...POWER!..POWER!...WAVE OFF! WAVE OFF  WAVE OFF!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: but the Tomcat horrifyingly settles tail-low toward the deck. The deck crew watches in terror as the plane wallows in toward them. The LSO'S turn, take a few steps and throw themselves off the flight deck. They sail into the night toward the surging seas a hundred feet below, then are caught in safety nets hung off the side.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: SHUT YOUR ENGINES DOWN, YOU'VE ARRIVED

direction.raw_text: .  THE PLANE Settles, settles, standing on it's engines, trying to arrest it's downward momentum. The hook raises sparks as it skids across the deck... The plane stops falling and hangs for a moment, about to blast back up, when the hook catches the last wire.. The wire snags it, plucking 45,000 pounds of fuel, metal and men out of the air and slamming it all to the deck. WHAMMMM! Right wheel flies up the deck and over the side...the gear collapses. The plane SCREECHES sideways. The crew watches helplessly as it skids slams into it and comes to rest in cloud of fuel vapor and steam. The LSO runs up, shouting into the mike. LSO COUGAR, GOOSE...COME IN COUGAR! SHUT YOUR ENGINES DOWN, YOU'VE ARRIVED.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! ACKNOWLEDGE!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! ACKNOWLEDGE! Crash crew leaps into action. The fire crew is there. The man in the Silver Suit jumps up on the wing and crawls to the cockpit. The figures inside are not moving. He hits the canopy release. The canopy pops open. Silver suit grabs at the rear seat harness release. He screams through his suit's aluminized cloth...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Goose, can you hear me?  Goose! Nothing for a moment. He's dead! Then the RIO'S helmet moves...His head turns. He tears the mask away from his face, looks up at Silver Suit. His head clears.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, Hello... Valet parking? Silver suit is stunned for a moment. He straightens up, his head inclines quizzically. Then it hits him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Son of a bitch!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You will put it up front, with the Porsches? He grabs him under the armpits, drags him out of the plane. GOOSE Hey...easy...Take it easy... I'm a veteran! Goose grabs a passing crewman by the arm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can you check under the hood. I thought I heard a funny noise. Other crewmembers help Cougar out. He seems stunned, but Goose reacts to his fear with frantic one-liners. He grabs a crew member's radio, as Silver Suit helps him away and looks to the figures of the Admiral and the Air Boss far up on the bridge... He waves to them, does his best impression...Desi Arnaz.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lucy...Ricky...I'n Home!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .  BRIDGE FLIGHT DECK A moment of disbelief... Then hysterical, tension relieving laughter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .  FLIGHT DECK Goose spots Cougar being helped out. He pulls away, reaches back into the cockpit and grabs Cougar's snapshot of wife and kid. They lead Goose away as firemen blast the aircraft with foam.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is it extra for the hot wax?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .  BRIDGE  - FLIGHT DECK - AIR BOSS AIR BOSS Clear the flight deck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .  FLIGHT DECK A TILLIE, a four wheel mobile crane, slams up to the plane and slings its lifting harness. Goose turns to Silver Suit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well...there goes your tip.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .  INT. MAVERICK'S PLANE They have monitored the chatter. WIZARD It's Goose. He's alright. Bring it left...You're settling.  IS THE DECK CLEAR?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (softly)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...DON'T CLIMB...OKAY, HOLD WHAT YOU GOT! Wizard does a quick sign of the cross, reaches down, grabs his balls...as...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .  FLIGHT DECK The TOMCAT slams onto the deck, clearing the wreckage by inches.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .  INT. CARRIER HATCHWAY - FLIGHT SURGEON, OTHERS Watch as they bring a shaken Cougar past. Goose, eyes wild, waves at Maverick and Wizard, rolling up. They flame out - VVOOOMMMMM! They sit there, immobile, waiting for a tow, looking numb.  Goose does his "stewardess".
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: On behalf of your Captain and your crew, I want to thank you for flying VF101. And next time your plans include the middle of the goddamn ocean in the dead of frigging night, I hope you'll think of Naval Aviation. The surgeon looks into Goose's eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stress reaction...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Check his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (wobbling off) Never mind my head, check my shorts!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .  SICK BAY - LATER Cougar lies alone in the dimness, staring at the overhead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 03 LEVEL - BELOW DECKS - OFFICER'S COUNTRY The usual CLANGS, WHISTLES, ENGINES of Navy life sound FORLORN ECHOING through the dim, deserted passage. From the distance, a single figure passes in and out of the glow of the overhead lights. Cougar comes closer, hobbling unsteadily. He reaches a door, pulls himself erect and knocks on the sign: Commander Tom Otawoczek
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .  STINGER'S CABIN The skipper works at his desk, responds without looking up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come in. He looks up. Cougar stands in the doorway, a strange, dazed look on his face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cougar, what is it? You should be in sick bay. What are you doing? He walks over to the skipper's desk. His eyes are glazed, but his jaw is firm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thinking of my wife and kid. A determined movement. Hand to chest.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . OMITTED Something metal hits it, skids across the polished surface and clangs up against the coffee mug: gold wings.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .  PASSAGEWAY Cougar comes out of Stinger's room, bumps into Goose, and Maverick. He turns the other way.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cougar! He stops, turns to them. There is nothing to say. Goose hands him his snapshot. Cougar looks at his wife and kid for a moment, then looks up at them. He turns away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cougar?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) Maverick, Goose...Come in here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .  STINGER'S OFFICE - DOORWAY Maverick appears, followed by Goose. They stand at attention.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sir? The Skipper says nothing. Maverick sees the wings on the desk. He enters, walks over, stares down at them. He picks them up. GOOSE Don't worry. I'll talk to him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's a good pilot.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I talked a man back once. Three months later, we lost him. It's his decision. Only he knows.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's the best you have. He's going Top Gun!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Was.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Was going. (Turns to Maverick.) Now you are.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Me? Maverick stares at the wings, lost in conflicting emotions.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, he's going (indicating Goose) and he needs someone to fly the plane.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Skipper, you can't do this!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I didn't do it, he did it himself. Something about a wife and kid. The fact is, he's lost it. He knows it. I know it. You were up there, you know it, too.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Give him a break, Skipper. It was raining snakes up there. He'll be alright, soon as all the gorillas go home... The Skipper stares at Goose, non-plussed for a moment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know some RIOS are a little wiggy...but you abuse the priviledge! I don't believe I'm going to have to put the two of you in the same cockpit...but there it is! It may be good for the Navy. It might be good for you, but most of all, it's good for me. It'll get you out of my sight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But, Skipper, Cougar's been picked for Top Gun...He's the best of the best!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, you'll just have to make do with him (indicates Maverick). Goose and Maverick exchange looks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mav's a great flyer but....
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's a hell of a flyer. In fact, he's so damn good he might have been picked for Top Gun himself. Except for one thing. (SCREAMS) He just can't seem to follow orders! Stinger moves slightly, to stand now, directly in front of Maverick and speak eye to eye at four inches.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You just did an incredibly brave thing! What you should have done was land your plane. You don't own that plane, the taxpayers do. I should ream you out for it. But it just doesn't work with you. You're a hell of a flyer. You are maybe ...too good. You never really stepped in it yet. So this is your chance. I'm gonna send you up against the best. They are better than you. Maybe they'll knock that shine off your eagle and you'll see, finally, where discipline and teamwork fit it. Maverick hasn't really heard anything but TOPGUN. He snaps out of it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sir?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That is all. Tell me about the MiG some other time...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes sir! He snaps off a salute and does an about face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maverick.. He turns back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes sir..
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The wings.. He looks down at the wings in his hands, slowing walks over places them gently on the Skipper's desk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gentlemen!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sir? His facade cracks just slightly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good luck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .  INT. PASSAGEWAY Maverick and Goose push through a gauntlet of aircrews. They have become notorious. Guys grab at them...questions...the MiGs?..What happened up there? How close did they get? What did the MiGs do? One word is heard over and over..."TopGun". Goose is left behind in the crowd. Maverick pushes through. He walks fast...faster. Up ladders, around turns, down ladders, through passageways. Faster. He breaks into a trot, then a canter, squeezing past enlisted men, parts lockers, then he breaks into a run...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .  EXT - CARRIER - NIGHT AND STORM A hatch slams open on the side of the Carrier. He's out on a catwalk, instantly soaked, running on rain slicked stairs cantilevered high over the breaking seas. He plunges forward to the bow of the ship, stands on the very peak. He is yelling something. He stands there as the bow plunges terrifyingly into the trough. The water rises like a green mountain, up, up to break just a few feet below him, showering him with spray. The noise is incredible. Come around on his face. It is maddened. He raises his fist and punches the night. The foaming slope of the wave rushes up, changing color as it DISSOLVES TO: Desert Sand whipping by...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .  MOJAVE DESERT - 1 WEEK LATER A big bike, a real big bike, a turbo...rockets across the desert. Fast. Real fast. Aviator shades low above the handlebars --Maverick. Goose hangs on in back. It cranks faster, pulls closer...ENGINE SCREAMING. It cranks up a notch, it's going to explode. It can't go faster, but it does. It SCREAMS HIGHER. It ROARS under, by and away, leaving dust...
direction.name: direction

result.heading: HISS AND POP OF METAL COOLING

direction.raw_text: .  THE BIKE - STILL Silence. Just the HISS AND POP OF METAL COOLING. Maverick sits on it, staring out past us. Goose looks over Maverick's shoulder. We see why. Feet come into the frame. Then the uniform: California Highway Patrol.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .  COUNTRY ROAD - NEAR SAN DIEGO 40A.  ANGLE ON MAVERICK. CHP enters the frame, the usual hypercivil arrogance tinged with awed disbelief. The usual questions are spaced for effect as if he might be talking to some other form of life. Maverick is off the bike, standing at attention. Goose follows more slowly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Son. Do you know why I stopped you? Maverick has some good idea how to deal with authority.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes sir. I do sir The CHP adjusts his own aviator shades.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well... What   is   it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (more than sincere) Sir. You are going to give me a warning, Sir!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - A touch of a smile, quickly surpressed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: License and registration. Maverick hands them over with his Navy ID. CHP scans them, hesitates a moment over the last, looks up with a touch more respect.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lieutenant, do you know how fast you were going?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes sir. I do, Sir.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well? MAVERICK Sir. I was going Mach point one five.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: nods sagely.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: One SIXTH the speed of sound!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes sir.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (a guess) Lieutenant... What do you... usually fly?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: F-14's sir.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (new respect) Tomcats?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes sir! A long pause. Respect in the cop's eyes. He taps the Navy ID on the handlebars...staring at this sincere young man.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lieutenant... Is there... a Russian attack?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No sir! But you have to be ready. The cop nods and stares at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .  EXT. MIRAMAR NAVAL AIR STATION - LATER 41A.  OMIT The bike is BLURPING... barely going fast enough to stay upright. Maverick cool in shades and campaign cap dorks past the hanger with the sign: FIGHTERTOWN, USA. He pulls ahead. In back of him, escorting with flashers...the CHP. They pull up at the gate. Maverick and Goose salute the guard, hands over their ID. The CHP gets out of his car, leans against the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lieutenant. Maverick turns to him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, Sergeant?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Remember one thing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sir?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Outside of this gate... I...am Top Gun.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes sir! He salutes. The CHP returns a snappy one. He gets back in his car and turns away. Maverick receives his ID and clearance. As he passes through, a couple of pilots in flight suits (ICE AND HOLLYWOOD) stare at him. The taller, dark, cool one speaks in a dry voice, meant to be overheard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Uh oh, police escort. This one must be a real killer. The second pilot grins big at them. Maverick turns slightly stares over his shades at them as he passes. Goose grins back the challenge.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .  AERIAL COMBAT - VIETNAM ERA - F4'S, MIG 17'S - STOCK The Doors on the soundtrack.  Jets swoop, missiles fire, a plane explodes. Gun camera views of MiGs, SAMS, flak, bombing runs...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: During the Korean War, the Navy kill ratio was twelve-to-one. We shot down twelve of their jets for every one of ours. In Vietnam, this ratio fell to three-to-one. Our pilots depended on missles. They lost their dogfighting skills. F-14's fighting with F-5's. Music becomes current. VIPER (V.O.) Top Gun was created to teach ACM. Air Combat Maneuvering...Dogfighting. Richthofen, Guynemer, Rickenbacker, Galland, Rudel, Bong would envy us. We do just what they did, but we do it beyond the speed of sound. 43.  INT. DAY - TOP GUN ORIENTATION ROOM.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - A tough-looking, confident leader in a blue flight suit, stands before a video-tape monitor. Behind him, on the monitor, the dogfighting continues.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: By the end of Vietnam we upped our kill ratio to thirteen to one. He turns on the lights. We see his audience in F.G.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're here 'cause you're the top one per cent of all naval aviators.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sixteen young men - eight flight crews - sit at attention. They are trim, fit and confident - high school heroes, college jocks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're the elite, the best of the best. We're gonna make you better, because you're job is damned important. ANOTHER ANGLE - THE MEN The camera moves among them. Hold on one of the men; the one who greeted Maverick at the gate, Ice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: With the tensions in the world today, the potential for confron- tation is greater than ever, and carrier pilots will be the first ones there. Air combat excellence is vital. Ice is not looking at the speaker, but, rather, in our direction. HOLLYWOOD, a blond, good-looking pilot, whispers something to him, and gestures. Ice is getting the lowdown on someone. The camera moves and we see who that someone is, as Maverick enters the frame. VIPER ...Someone once asked me if training men for air combat made the world less safe--flying loaded guns... an accidental confrontation and so forth... Maverick feels the stare of the other man and glances in his direction. Their eyes meet. Ice smiles coldly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (Con't) My answer is: the dangerous thing is being unprepared. You want trouble, that's what you get when things don't work out, when you can't do what you say you can. When you don't know what you can do. And when your opponents aren't sure either. We are not policy. We don't make policy. Elected officials ...civilians, do that. We are the instrument of policy. The tip of the spear. So we had best be sharp. Maverick has turned to look at Ice. Ice glances back in his direction. Maverick looks at the back of the room where guys in blue flight suits stand. They are the instructors. They look relaxed, poised, mean.  Goose is looking up front...Where Viper has stopped. Goose nudges Maverick. GOOSE (whispers) What are you doing?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nothing...That's McGown...that's Singer, isn't it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Turn around, pay attention. What are you doing?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (musing to himself) ...Just wondering...(turns back) ...who is the best. He's shocked to find Viper staring right at him, with a killer grin on his face. He's feels caught like a naughty schoolboy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Really...    (smiles) Ya know. We'd like to know who's best too. That's why we've got that plaque on the wall... with the Top Top Gun crew from each class. You think maybe your name's gonna be on it? Maverick knows he's in trouble, considers the social alternatives, then tells him the truth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes sir. A couple of ooo's and aahh's from the guys. The instructors stare the challenge at him. He slides lower in his seat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Considering the company you're in, that's a pretty arrogant attitude.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (somewhat chastised) Yes sir.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I like that in a fighter pilot. (couple of laughs from the guys) It's okay to be confident. You have to think you're King Kong to want to try to land on carriers. Just keep in mind the other component of success...teamwork. Viper gathers his notes, the lecture is over.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes sir. Viper turns back for one more thought.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gentlemen, this is about combat. Remember, there are no points for second place. Dismissed. Viper walks out. Maverick finds Goose looking at him, quizzically. Others mill around the plaque.  A big, friendly bear of a RIO speaks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A plaque?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's not the plaque. The winner can get assigned here as instructor. He gets to fight every day. They move closer to examine the names on the plaque.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .  EXT. "O" CLUB - NIGHT. Fast cars in the driveway, fast music blares into the night. It's Wednesday; Animal Night. Maverick, Goose Hollywood and Wolfman walk to the entrance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .  INT. WOXOF BAR Loud music, low ceiling, plaques of the squadrons line the walls. A dancer gyrates on stage, largely ignored by pilots talking with their hands. Every pretty girl in San Diego seems to be here. It's a noisy, rowdy place--a "steam releaser" for people under pressure. Nevertheless, there is a control to it all, there are none of the usual bar types, just pilots and Naval Officers. The Ghost Riders enter. The place is on fire:  a mob of dancers, flashing lights, blaring HARD ROCK MUSIC. Beer flows. Pilots talk flying and hustle girls.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - AN A7 pilot stands by the bar. He knows Goose and speaks loudly for his benefit.. A7 PILOT You know the Fighter Pilots motto? It's better to be dead than to look bad. They grin broadly. Goose replies as they brush past.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know, Frank, anybody gets off on bombing the shit out of dirt has got to be queer. Goose exchanges friendly punches with the attack pilots. Maverick's introductions and friendly barbs are drowned by the music. Maverick is a bit reserved. He doesn't move among the crowd as naturally as Goose does. Hollywood and Wolfman drift away, searching for quarry. Goose orders beer. He nods toward a TALL YOUNG MAN across the room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Keller, Black Lion Squadron. I knew him at Pensacola. He's damn good.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is there anybody in the Navy you don't know? GOOSE Gotta keep track of the competition. Goose suddenly reaches out and grabs a guy moving past.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Slider -- they let you into Top Gun? If you're among the best in the Navy, I tremble for the security of this country.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why Goose, whose butt did you kiss to get here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The list is long, but distinguished.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So's my Johnson.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is Maverick. Smiles good-naturedly, shakes hands with Mav. SLIDER So I've heard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who's your pilot?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tom Kazansky.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (very impressed) No shit. The Iceman....
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mister to you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You think you can stay up with us.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think, yeah, we'll show you a thing or two.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is Evan Mitchell, he steers the thing. SLIDER So I heard. Steers it pretty close. Sorry to hear about Cougar. He was a good man.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Still is..
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah. That's what I meant. Suddenly, behind them, a flame shoots up. Someone ducks his head and swallows it. The pilot sets an empty glass on the bar.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What was that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Flaming Hooker. Sort of an institution around here. Or maybe this is the institution, I forget which. It's the house drink. It'll warm the cockles of your heart ... and other things depending on where you spill it. He motions to the barmaid and she moves over, sets them up. GOOSE holds a demitasse glass. The barmaid pours Drambuie. They look at Goose apprehensively. Goose looks at nearby flyers in Camo fatigues.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You can't show fear in front of Marines...They're like Doberman's they'll go for your throat, it's instinctive. He takes out match and lights it. Maverick holds his arm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You ever done this before?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What, been drunk? Sure! Plenty! He downs it all in one gulp, slaps the glass on the bar, still aflame. He stands there, blinking. SLIDER How was it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Could use a dash more jet fuel. The others are duly impressed. Maverick's gaze falls on Ice watching from the end of the bar - Slider takes one, Maverick takes one too, downs it in a gulp. Sundown, taking up the challenge, motions for one. The barmaid pours it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Careful, don't make an ash of yourself... He tries to drink the flaming concoction. He tries to go for a sip, but it's too close to his face, he tries to tilt the flame away, but that doesn't work. Finally he goes for the gulp. He burns his lip and misses.  He sets his hair on fire. It goes up in a WHOOOSH!!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeow!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mayday! Down in flames! He throws a beer in Sundown's face, quenching the fire. Sundown blinks through the beer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thanks, I needed that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You guys are not only crazy, you're dangerous! Ice comes up from the end of the bar. He motions the Barmaid for another; it comes. Goose lights it. He gulps it down, cool as hell.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (Disdainfully) Frat boys. He walks away. Slider goes after him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who is that guy?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's Kazanski.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No shit! That why they call him Ice?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nope. It's the way he flies - Ice cold. No mistakes. Wears you down. After enough time, you just get bored and frustrated, you do something stupid, and he's got you. Maverick moves in Ice's direction. He passes Wolfman dancing with a girl with bright purple fingernails.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why do you all have such funny names?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You gotta have a call sign that's just your own...never changes...you have to recognize it immediately. Then, if someone shouts "Wolf, break left!"..you react right away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why do they call you Wolf?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (smiles) Oh, I don't know. Goose comes up with his arm around a girl.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey Mav, this is Sally. She doesn't believe a word I say. Tell her I'm married, will you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, he's married--but then again, he,s not dead. Sally laughs and tries to pull Goose back toward the dance floor. Something in Maverick's eyes makes him hang back with his partner.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - DANCERS GIRL Could I get a call sign?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, I don't know. That depends.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: On what?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, it doesn't just happen, you gotta do something famous.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Like what?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh...I'll think of something. Maverick smiles at this, but seems on edge... He watches a few pretty girls enter and eye the pilots in their flight suits, then turns and walks up to Ice, who sits, drinking with Slider. Maverick walks over to him. Ice notices Slider's attention going to Maverick. He turns and grins at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Figured it out yet?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Figured out what?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who is the best.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nope.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Need a hint?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think I can work it out on my own.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You like to work alone. I've heard that about you. MAVERICK I've heard of you, too. You were in 124 with Bargamian.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And you were with Cougar. He was my roommate in flight school.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's a good man.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The best.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You must have soloed under a lucky star. First the MiG, then you slide into Cougar's place.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's not Cougar's place. It's ours. ICE What do you think it was? Was it that MiG contact that did it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did what?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Got you here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're here because we're the best flyers in the wing. Not because of some MiG encounter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What luck! Guys fly their whole career without seeing a MiG up close...You're famous.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You mean notorious. Something in the way he says it. It's not quite a joke, more an insult. Maverick's about to take the whole conversation too far when something...someone catches his eye. She catches quite a few eyes in this room. She is very pretty and she's walking in on the arm of a Commander. Maverick turns back, but the moment has passed. Ice dismisses him with a nod and weak smile. Goose pulls him away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do these guys think, I made Cougar quit?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pay no attention to it. They're just trying to rattle you. It's all psychological. Sit down..and drink. He deposits Maverick at a chair by a table where other pilots cluster watching and listening to Bugs shoot down his wristwatch. Maverick broods...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We were just really diving down and by then we were right over downtown Haiphong.  It was some great shit. Jack says, "What are you doing?" "What, what am I doing, Jack?" He says, "What are you doing?" I said, "I'm rolling in, Jack." "Bugs, we're at thirty-two hundred feet. Oh shit, we were like zooom... So we scraped down at hundred feet right over--downtown Hanoi!  Oh shit, goddamn it! And blowing down the river. And so once we were there we let down to about fifty feet just going down the river and Jack says... "Bugs... don't ever do that again!" "Okay, right, Jack, I'll never do that again!" Maverick pays little or no attention. He broods and drinks. Suddenly, Hollywood nudges him, he turns.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What, what is it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Target passing. Check your six.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Never mind mine. Check hers. They turn. Long legs, great ass, beautiful.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Her six is a ten! Uh oh, a turn to engage.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maverick sees a stranger, and somehow he knows, he knows even then.  Wolfman turns, sees her walking too.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bogey...9 o'clock level.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nine thirty. Bogey?  You presume that hostile?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, we should contact and check it out. She has turned toward them. She passes by. They start to make a move for her. But just then she finds her date at the bar; a distinguished man with Captain's stripes. Their smiles freeze and they slide back in their chairs. Maverick can't stop looking at her...After a while, the intensity of his gaze draws her attention. She feels him. She is nodding and smiling to her date, but her eyes scan the room like radar. A warning tone goes off in his brain dolu dolu dolu as they lock on him. He feels that thrill of excitement and fear you get when you know you're targeted in someone's scope. Her eyes hold on him for a long moment...long enough, and then sweep by the rest of the room. She turns her attention back to the Captain and laughs at something he says. Over in a corner, Goose chats up a couple of San Diego girls.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The family unit -- that's the most important thing. It's the only thing you can count on. I'm married --did I tell you that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Four times. We don't believe you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've been married since I was eighteen. Why don't you believe me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Because you don't look married. FIRST GIRL You're not even wearing a ring.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (big smile) I take it off when I'm chasing women. It's the only honorable thing to do.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's half listening to Bugs rattle on.  His eyes are drawn back to the woman. He tries not to stare. She seems to know a lot of people in the club. He looks away. Hollywood is chatting up a girl with a sincerity that cannot be taught. His line is just as polished as his appearance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You don't think about death up there, but you think a lot about the danger. One mistake and you're a smoking hole in the ground.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I never knew it was so dangerous.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh yeah, it makes everything down here more meaningful. You feel a certain intensity of life, and you want to grab onto every moment. Maverick looks up at the bar again. A shock. She (Charlie) is staring right at him, intensely, as her date whispers something in her ear. She notices him, staring back, quickly looks away, embarrassed. She says something to the man. He nods and turns away as someone else grabs his attention. The woman, now wouldn't look this way for anything. She picks up her purse from the bar and walks through the crowd and out of the room. Impulsively, Maverick's up, he follows. 46.  INT. HALLWAY - OUTSIDE THE BAR He breaks out, looks around, doesn't see her. Someone disappears around a corner. He moves after.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - A door slams shut. Impulsively, before he realizes what he is doing, he's through it. 47.  WOMEN'S ROOM. A feminine GASP!  He should have looked at the sign on the door. The realization of where he is hits him too late. She is standing by the mirror, with her make-up out, looking back at him. He's not quite sure what to do. A hasty retreat would be appropriate, if embarrassing. Ah, what the hell, he is a fighter pilot!  He just walks right over to her...no idea what he will say. She's got her lipstick out, twisting it. She looks over at him with an amused smile.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Long cruise, was it? She leans over the sink, puts on lipstick, sees his eyes cover her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Anything I can do to help, Lieutenant?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lots of things. She laughs. He is sort of attractive, but there are other girls in the room, she doesn't want to be too encouraging...She tries not to grin at his embarrassment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll bet!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Uhhh...Anything I can do for you? She laughs again, doesn't know what it is...could be chemical, but she's instinctively attracted.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah. Hold this. It might be safer. She hands him a makeup mirror. Starts redoing her lipstick. He just stares at her...She looks up at him, than back to her warpaint. Finally, when it comes, it is cool and amused.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now I know why all the girls come here. They know how horny you guys get. But this...is ridiculous.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's not that. Mock anger. She's toying with him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It isn't?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, it is. It is that, too.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's a big comfort to me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I could be, too.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How so?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Save you from a big mistake with that other guy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And on to a bigger one with you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, most likely.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Was there ever a girl who didn't like fighter pilots?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I heard of one once. She laughs again, shakes her head...another cowboy! She gently takes the compact out of his hands, snaps it closed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm really flattered, Lieutenant, but I don't go out with pilots.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then what are you doing here? Three pretty blondes enter and look at Maverick quizzically but not without interest.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think the question is...what are you? She tries to keep a straight face as she walks out of the room. The other girls look at him expectantly.  A beat.  He just stands there, then realizes he's holding her lipstick. MAVERICK Hi. I'm here to talk about a new concept in cosmetics...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .  WOXOF BAR. She returns, spots the Captain, motioning to her.  Maverick enters, goes to the other end of the bar. He orders a drink. It comes. He drinks it, pays for it, moves off toward the door. Someone backs into his path, he moves quickly and bumps into someone else; her. CHARLIE Sorry. She sees it's him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My fault. Should have watched where I was going. Her hand goes to his collar. She adjusts his insignia. She smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where's your wing man? Who's watching your six?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Uh, nobody, I guess. One final adjustment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Too bad. She breaks the spell abruptly, turns away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: See you around. Maverick finds his voice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can I walk you out?She turns back to him, a smile.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm with someone. 48.  EXT. "O" CLUB - LATER THAT NIGHT P.O.V. - From a car in the parking lot, we see Charlie and the Captain leave the club. They walk directly toward us and stop. She turns, says something polite...a peck on the cheek. He turns away. A dome light briefly illuminates the interior of the car as a door opens. It rocks slightly as someone gets in. Charlie turns back and walks over, taking her keys out. She opens the door to the car and gets in. 48A.  EXT. CAR - NIGHT She starts the car and pulls away. Suddenly, a figure sits up in the back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I thought he'd never leave.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeow! Startled, she nearly drives off the road. She turns to him, startled.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You! What are you doing here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Everybody's got to be somewhere.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What if Captain Dawson had come with me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It would have been really embarrassing!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How did you know this was my car?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Simple deduction. It's fast. It's pretty. Sleek and stylish...It's your color...matches your lipstick.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's all!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And I asked someone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You think you're pretty smart.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think I'm in love.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .  EXT. GUARD GATE She pulls up at the guard gate, a MARINE CORPORAL is on duty. He sees the pretty girl pull up and stop, leans over helpfully.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can I help you, Ma'am? She smiles even more sweetly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know, Corporal. Can you do anything about this lunatic? The car door swings open. Maverick gets out. The car roars away. He stands in the glare of the spotlight...rocking on his heels, looking across at the guard, who snaps to attention and stares holes in his chest.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .  INT. TOP GUN - NEXT MORNING. Two guys in flight suits run down stairs past stencils of MiG kills on walls, then down corridor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not so fast...my head. They skid to stop outside a door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .  INT. HANGAR Ground crews work on planes in B.G. Jester in middle of lecture. Door bursts open. Sundown and Flex skid to a halt when they see whole class looking at them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who are you? SUNDOWN I'm Sundown.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, right. You're late. Viper breaks in, indicating Flex.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And who are you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Flex VIPER Flex...? You don't look like Flex to me. You call that muscle? Doesn't look like muscle. Looks like...Pork. They laugh. Even Sundown has to laugh, scratching his chest.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What're you laughing at? You're Fungus. Stops scratching.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fungus!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't make an issue of it, it'll stick.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It'll stick anyway. Viper turns away...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now to continue. In this class we will be dealing with F-5's and A4's, as our MiG simulators. Technically the F-5 does not have the thrust to weight ratio of the MiG-21--it also does not bleed energy below 300 knots like the MiG-21 does. The A4 does not turn as well as the MiG-17 but has significantly better visibility. Maverick looks back to his notes. SFX footsteps...door opening. Viper looks up to back of room door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hi, Charlie. Good, our TAGREF's here. Charlie's the most qualified to get into P subs and curves, and VN diagrams. Maverick turns to see the TAGREF walk forward.  Maverick stares at her as she passes without acknowledging him. He is surprised, embarrassed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Charlotte Blackwood--code name Charlie-- not your ordinary TAGREF. Charlie has her Ph.D. in astrophysics--she's a civilian contractor so you don't salute her...or anything else. Is that clear? She walks to the front and starts her presentation. She talks about something very technical, arcane. MiG tactics, technology. As the briefing rattles on, Maverick reacts to her. Goose glances over at him. He, too, recognizes the girl. He looks at his partner. Maverick feels his stare.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello, I think I have some new data for you...Now a MiG 21 has a problem with the inverted flight tanks. It won't do a Negative G push over. Even below one G, they risk a flame out. Operationally, they will do a zero to one G only. A snicker from the audience. She hesitates momentarily, goes on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The latest intelligence shows that the most they will do in operation is one....is there something wrong, Lieutenant.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't think you're altogether right...about the MiG, that is. She stops--some of the pilots look at him. Viper glares.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I beg your pardon.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, I beg yours. But I don't think you're right on that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why not?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I saw one.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You saw a MiG 21?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I saw a MiG do a 4 G negative dive.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (She doesn't believe him) Where did you see that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's classified. Nervous buzz in the room. Viper goes rigid. Charlie can't believe it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's what?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's classified. Like Hollywood says, I could tell you, but then I'd have to kill you. Pork stifles a laugh, the others chuckle. Viper is embarrassed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maverick!!! She stops Viper with a glance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's all right. She can handle it. She is very cool, not overbearing. She says it calmly. She doesn't want to embarrass him any more than he is, but she has to get the facts straight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lieutenant, I have a top secret clearance. The Pentagon sees to it that I know more than you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not in this case.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (Flatly.) You saw a MiG push negative 4G?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, ma'am.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where were you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: On his six. Little stifled laughs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He was in a 4G Negative dive and you were on his six?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, ma'am, At first. Then I was directly above him. She stares at him for a moment, then she has him. She goes for the kill.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If you were directly above him, how did you see him?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was inverted. A real buzz in the room.  Ice laughs audibly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You were in a 4G inverted dive with a MiG 21?   (She can't believe it.) At what range ?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Two.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Two miles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Two meters. Chuckles, barely suppressed. Goose pipes up to deflect attention.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: One and a half, actually. I got a polaroid.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (Flatly.) Lieutenant...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ma'am?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What were you doing there?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Giving him the bird. Open laughter. She thinks it's at her. She grows red.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The what?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know. The finger. He shows her, but she can handle this. CHARLIE So you're the reason those
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: talks failed. The room breaks into laughter. At him. Now he grows red. Goose puts his hand on Maverick's arm, shakes his head as if to say: "Let it go, pal, she got you". She looks at Viper. He doesn't know whether to laugh or cry. He knows there's something here he doesn't control.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lieutenant!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's just like he says, sir.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (He snaps) I don't care!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CORRIDOR - OUTSIDE LECTURE HALL She walks away. He runs up and stops her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why didn't you tell me you were a TAGREF? She studies him coolly for a moment, like a specimen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It never came up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You let me make a fool of myself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You seemed determined to do that anyway.. Why didn't you tell me you were a famous MiG insulter?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Would it have made a difference? CHARLIE No.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What would?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know, I'm assigned to this school. I see sixteen new hotshots every eight weeks. Your attention is flattering, but not really productive. Why don't you keep your mind on flying. She reaches over and aligns his collar insignia.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why can't you keep this straight? She smiles at him and walks away. Maverick turns, sees the others sizing him up. Most of them grin. Maverick moves down the corridor past the CO's Office. Viper leans against the doorsill. He lights a pipe, laconically eyes Maverick. His tone gives away nothing, like an ELINT probe eliciting a response.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maverick... Where'd you get that call sign?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ahhh... Runs in the family, sir.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're father was Marvin Mitchell..
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes sir.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A good man. Good flyer. Viper turns away. MAVERICK Yes sir. Thank you sir. Maverick watches him for a beat, he's been tested, but he's not sure how or why. He turns to catch up with Goose and the others.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: At twenty-eight thousand feet, the two planes circle each other, going in opposite directions. As they jockey for position, they snap past each other like ends of bullwhips. The earth spins, the horizon appears and disappears. With each hard turn, Maverick and Goose can be heard "grunting" to keep blood in their brains, to keep from passing out. The fight is hard, physical, and exhausting. The extreme G forces--6.5--flatten them against their seats, causing their heads to weigh over one hundred pounds. Maverick strains to turn his head and track the other jet as it streaks past at Mach One. MAVERICK I've lost him -- where is he?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: On your six -- coming hard. Four hundred. Losing airspeed! He's on your six and closing fast! Hard left! HARD LEFT! Maverick jerks the stick left, and the F-14 takes an astonishing turn. Jester ROARS past into a wide arc.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Great move. Great
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He should've had me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Take it down. Let's bug out of here. Call for a draw.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No way. I'll nail him this time. Going vertical.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - rocketing toward space. Jester is left in direct line with the sun, and his canopy is sprayed with a blinding glare. Going ballistic is dangerous. The plane flys like a bullet, obeying the laws of physics, not the pilot's touch on control surfaces. The ballistic call warns other aircraft that he is, for the moment, out of control.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's blind -- you got him!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! NO JOY! WHERE ARE YOU?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's out of energy! You got control? Unload! The F-14 peels over the egg, in a backward dive. It rockets down the outside, gaining energy. Over the ROAR of jets, the SCREAM of the wind, Goose shouts data, but it is muffled, a distant voice in a typhoon. Through the canopy, we see Jester, and he hangs in the air like a sparrow in the path of a falcon.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: in windscreen - a diamond in a box. Maverick lines up the diamond with Jester, and we hear the high pitched tone BEEPING.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . FIGHT'S OFF.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's right. We're at ten thousand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No way. I got you, sucker. You're going down. Jester maneuvers, but Maverick keeps him in the gunsight. The BEEPING is louder, faster.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In the envelope. FOX TWO MISSILE SHOT. YOU'RE GONE, JESTER, DEAD! GOOSE (stunned) Goddamn! We beat him! There is an edge of anger in Jester's voice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . GET YOUR BUTTS ABOVE THE HARD DECK. RETURN TO BASE IMMEDIATELY. They are brought up short for a moment, then the thrill of victory gets the best of them. Goose lets out a war whoop. The F-14 sweeps up, rolls into an Immelman..
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We did it!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look, Ma, top of the world!
direction.name: direction

result.heading: JESTER WE'RE BELOW THE HARD DECK
GET YOUR BUTTS ABOVE THE HARD DECK

direction.raw_text: .  EXT. MIRAMAR - LANDING PATTERN. Maverick's Tomcat breaks hard and high, rolls over on its side, wings perpendicular to the ground. Goose sees the world go sideways.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ahhh...A little high on the left, don't you think?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Right. He aileron rolls another quarter turn. Inverted, they pass right down the runway.  Goose looks out and insouciantly watches the world go by at 300 knots, upside down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Right. Much better. ...Ahhh...what do you call this?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's a victory roll.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I wouldn't call it victory.  It's more like...self immolation.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .  INT. CONTROL TOWER Controllers work. Officers watch the landing activity. One old salt, turns from the coffee machine, a cup of steaming Java microns from his lips. A ROAR. VABOOM! The Tomcat roars over. He yelps as hot coffee flys all over his shirt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EXT. MAVERICK'S F-14 They complete the roll, bank left, zoom right by the tower, level with the observation window. 52D.  F-14'S POV. Controllers look out at the F-14, mouths drop open. 52E.  ANGLE GOOSE He waves jauntily.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hi...Hi there. How ya doing in there?  Mav... Ahhh...you know, at one point I did want a Navy career.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on, relax...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You see all those guys with gold on their shoulders!!?... Oh, no, I think that was Johnson, Air Boss of the Kitty Hawk! MAVERICK Come on, we beat an instructor. How many times in your life do you get to do a victory roll? GOOSE Just once, if they take your plane away. They roll out, break over the runway. ***
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .  EXT. FLIGHTLINE. Maverick and Goose walk by parking Tomcats...Ice is unstrapping, Slider is climbing down. Ice looks at Maverick, says one word.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cowboys! Maverick keeps walking...Goose hangs back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nice. Always a good idea to show up your instructors. He nods toward Jester, glaring at them from his A4. Goose indicates the backseat of the Tomcat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, see any controls back there? (thinks about team loyalty, reacts to Jester's glare...) And anyway...we beat the Son of a Bitch! He turns and runs to catch up with Maverick.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .  INT. LOCKER ROOM - DAY Pilots half undressed. Maverick and Goose enter the room, carrying their helmets. The students look up at them, and Goose suddenly flashes a thumb's up sign with a grin. The students react with clenched fists, ad libs, high fives, victory punches.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You won?!!!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Didn't everybody? "Oooo" -- they all go "ooo" and laugh.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, we...got our butts kicked.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thirty seconds. That's all it took to blow us out of the sky.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We went like this, he went like that. I say to Hollywood: Where'd he go? Hollywood says: where'd who go?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And he's laughing. Right over the radio, He's laughing at us. Attention turns to the doorway as Ice and Slider enter. Ice gives a brief dramatic pause, then flashes thumbs up and smiles. The students celebrate Ice's win.  Ice handles the attention with the easy composure of one who is used to it. Maverick ignores him and begins to peel out of his G-suit. Ice moves toward his locker. ***
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You won. Congratulations.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maverick and Goose won too. Ice talks into his locker.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's not what I heard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We won! Ice turns back, stares them down, then turns back into his locker, dismissing them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Below the hard deck doesn't count. You guys are the second team, aren't you? Maverick gets up, moves to him, starts to say something, when Jester, breaks into the room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maverick, Goose. Viper's office. Now!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. TOPGUN CORRIDOR OUTSIDE CO'S OFFICE.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .  A lot of screaming and yelling, muffled by the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. ANTEROOM. Enlisted Yeomen and Chiefs go about their clerical duties in acute embarrassment mixed with curiousity. Behind the CO'S door, someone is screaming his head off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! The door bursts open. A big, brawling Officer - Johnson, the Air Boss - blasts out, nearly smashing into a female petty officer. She almost spills her coffee. Johnson looks right and left in fury too strong for words. He looks like he wants to smash something. They move out of his way, but he justs blasts through the door and disappears down the hall. The enlisted men turn to Viper's office.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jester stands inside stonefaced. Maverick and Goose are rigid. Viper...with excess calm deliberation, softly walks over, grasps the doornob. He glances in this direction. The glance is totally without expression, and even scarier for that. ***
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . ANGLE ENLISTED (MEN) In a flash, each man finds something totally engrossing in his work, or something terribly important to do elsewhere. Slowly, steadily, Viper swings his door closed.54.  INT. VIPER'S OFFICE He moves over to face Maverick. There is a SILENCE like after a train wreck; nothing but the POPPING of sprung metal and the low GASP of escaping steam. Viper speaks quietly, like a funeral director consoling the living. Makes you want to scream.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well....That about covers the flyby. Jester almost breaks into a grin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now...in addition...you broke two major rules of engagement. And... That's ...not good. Maverick gives no response. Viper continues.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lieutenant Candela lost sight of you, and called "no joy". You failed to respond. He stops and looks at Maverick... A beat. Maverick finally nods VIPER Why? Maverick is exhausted. It's been a long, rough day. His voice is a horse whisper.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I had him in view. I was peeling over the egg, into a dive. He saw me when I moved in for the kill. There wasn't any danger...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to Goose) Is that how you remember it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, sir. By the time we could respond, we were diving right into his view. Viper is not satisfied with the answer, but he moves on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The hard deck for this hop was ten thousand feet. Jester, at what point did you call off the fight?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just below ten thousand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But you continued to fight. Another pause, another grudging nod.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We weren't below for more than ten seconds. There was no danger. I had the shot. I took it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The rules of engagement are not flexible. They exist for your safety. You will obey them. Is that clear? Maverick thinks about continuing the discussion, but the thought is momentary. He quickly cuts his losses, gives Viper what he thinks he wants...He is just on the cusp of too sincere.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes sir, perfectly clear. I guess we were ...I was... just a little over enthusiastic. Viper measures him for a moment, then lets it go.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I guess you were. Dismissed. Maverick and Goose leave the room. Viper looks at Jester, picks up Maverick's fitness report. Doesn't read it, looks back at Jester.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know what to tell you, Skip.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tell me one thing. Jester waits.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...If you had to go into combat, would you want him with you? Jester turns, walks slowly around the room. The walls are lined with pictures; planes and pilots...history. There are MiG killers, attack squadrons, ground personnel...There's one picture of a Phantom in flight with the backseater mooning the camera. Other pictures show carriers, famous flyers, previous CO's. Finally Jester replys. JESTER Yep. Viper slaps shut the fitness report. JESTER He's seat of the pants... Completely unpredictable -- nothing by the book. All over the sky. But I don't know, Skip, he's really got something.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, we get one of these guys every damn class.  (laughs) "Maverick!" He throws the report on the desk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yup, a wild pony.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .  OMITTED 56.  INT. COCKPIT - NIGHT Wind ROAR, jet WHINE. Hollywood and Wolfman are being thrown about as Hollywood fights the stick.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. No. Look out, you lost it. They depart flight. Tumble. The horizon swings wildly as they go into flat spin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're dead! A face appears at 12,000 feet, right in front of their canopy. Goose's eyes bug at them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Man, you guys gooned it. Your laser butts are scattered across KANSAS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (disgusted with himself) Come on. I died enough for one night.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .  EXT. COCKPIT They climb out of the simulator - A cockpit sprung on moveable rams, surrounded by a dome on which video images are projected. As they climb down, Maverick and Goose climb up into the cockpit to take their place.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Have you guys ever considered career counseling?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . OMITTED 56B. SIMULATOR CONTROL ROOM - Filled with computers, tape transports and video screen representations of computer generated combat. Now Maverick flies it as Charlie and other techs watch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . COCKPIT Maverick flys the heck out of it. It's real. It lurches and bumps, the NOISES and sights look real. He gets on the tail of a MiG. It breaks, he breaks, then what he does is just too fast to follow. It screams around in a turn. Suddenly, there is a WHUMMP...ALARMS...the lights come on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What happened.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What did you do in there?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What did you do? You broke it!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . COMPUTER ANALYSIS ROOM Maverick and Goose enter. The techs cluster around the keyboards trying to reprogram, to figure out what went wrong.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You flew it off the template. Nobody ever did that before.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's what she said last night. She stares at Goose until he grins and moves off to give the others his valuable opinions on how to reprogram the computers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What is it about you? He just shrugs at her and smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What would you say, too fast...too quick...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And far too aggressive.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It is combat. Every second counts. CHARLIE The hottest moves in the world aren't gonna help you if you wind up alone.  Your wingman's got to be able to follow you. Trust you. Know that he can depend on you. It's more than just fancy flying.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, what you need...what you have to keep looking for...what you want to get is a wingman who can stay up with you. Who can match you move for move. Then you've got something.  I'm sorry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: For what?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That stuff about the MiG. I was out of line.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Apology acknowledged.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is that all?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What else do you want?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Um. You.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There you go with those moves again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Too aggressive?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't mix with the boys. I work here. Let's keep it professional.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm special.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (laughs) Yes. I'll give you that!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Give me a break, I'm asking you out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can't.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I thought there was something... That night in the club...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lieutenant...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Evan... or Maverick.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maverick...you know the rules of engagement.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (can't believe it.) The what?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Some one comes up hot on your six, what do you do?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you talking about?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You turn into him, check him out, identify friend or foe.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not your foe.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And if he's harmless, you disengage.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Harmless!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Uh hum.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What if he's not?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You have to shoot him down....If he's smart, he'll turn away before that happens.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Harmless. Nobody ever called me harmless before...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And probably never again. It's nothing personal. It's just...I know a lot of pilots. Maybe I'm immune...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't worry, I'm a new strain. And I don't give up. Everything I've ever wanted I've had to work like hell for. Well, how about it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How about what?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How about anything, anything you want to do.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hard to argue with that, isn't it...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A date... Coffee... A drink...A walk in the park.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What about the plane?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What plane.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Most of them invite me to sit in the cockpit...play with the levers and things. MAVERICK Well, get used to it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Used to what?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm different. CHARLIE I'm starting to sense that now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're slow to engage. But you'll come around. She pushes him out the door
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's make it at eight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Make what?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Anything.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay, anything. Just...go. I've gotta work. She closes the door, turns back to her screen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: thru 61 OMITTED ***
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .  BEACH LA JOLLA - DAY A day off. Pilots, other personnel are enjoying a day at the beach. There are bikinis, and beer, sunfishes and water skiing. The annual Over-the-Line (a variation of softball) tournament is in progress. The team from the Teddy Kennedy Driving School is whipping another known as Scum de Terre. The pilots are doing pretty well at blowing off steam.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .  UNDERSEA Undulating sea grass. Muffled HISS of the surf. A pretty fish comes into view. A spear shoots through it, and nails it to the ocean floor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .  SHORELINE Two figures pop to the surface and wade in to the beach. Maverick holds the wriggling fish. Charlie is repulsed. She pulls off her mask and snorkle, follows him in to shore..
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . THE BEACH They flop down. He drops the fish in front of her, sees her reaction at watching its death throes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why'd you do that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (surprised) I had the shot. She looks at him for a moment, then turns away, fiddles with her mask.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It dies. We live.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're an animal.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's true. What are you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't enjoy watching things suffer. He smashes the fish on a rock. It is still.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's not suffering anymore.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (she looks at him strangely, half jokes) You're horrible
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're not, cause you eat frozen meatballs?   (he puts it down) Things die. Every time you breathe, you kill millions of tiny organisms. Every time you eat, something had to die. CHARLIE You don't have to kill it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Somebody does. It's more honest this way. You do your own dirty work.
direction.name: direction
