direction.raw_text: You ever think about killing another human being?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: About as much as they think about killing me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Does it bother you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They know the rules...(this is too strong for her, she turns away, he comes around to her.) That's the deal. That's why you're up there. It's him or me. That's the price of admission. (she draws away) It bothers you, why? You're part of it. (She stiffens, he's losing her. He softens)  Everybody dies. Most people don't get to die for something. You don't want to confront it, do you. You want to keep it all clean, cerebral... velocity vectors, wing-load diagrams...You ever been up?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Flying?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You use your mind to keep things at a distance. You ever just let go? She doesn't answer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know what really scares me? Living too long. Losing my hair and my teeth...and my guts and my wind. And my brains...Sitting in a room with my hands in my lap, watching daytime TV. CHARLIE You don't believe any of this. You don't think you'll ever die.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's it, of course. When I'm up there and doing it, I'm cheating it every second. I'm subverting all laws...gravity...whatever. I'm skating the edge of it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Winston Churchill.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What he said..."There's nothing so exhilarating as being shot at without result."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All you've got is one life. I guess it's worth about the same to every body. You ever see an old woman after her husband has died? And the meaningless years of decline stretch ahead...  When you're in the air and doing something really dangerous, you can look ahead... maybe ten seconds. That's your whole future. That's as far as it goes. But imagine what those seconds are worth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What if you kill yourself? Think of everything you'll miss.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There is lots of stuff I don't know about...  Fine wine... great art... the opera. I guess if I live long enough, I'll get to it. If I don't, I'll never miss it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you really that brave?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (shakes his head no.) I watched my mother die. Cancer. She had a long time to think about it. They say you reach an agreement with death. Come to accept the fact that pretty soon you won't be here. I didn't see that. She... was very brave...braver than I am. You go up there, there isn't time to think. If you make a mistake, you're just a smudge on the ground. Simplifies funeral arrangements.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's just as I thought.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're totally insane.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (he smiles) Thanks very much. (he lifts the fish) Care for some suchi?.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: THE OTHER END OF THE BEACH

direction.raw_text: .  THE OTHER END OF THE BEACH - LATER A killer volleyball game in progress. Maverick and Charlie wander toward it, talking softly to themselves. Goose runs up and grabs him away. GOOSE Come on, we're next.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on, I got over six bucks on the line. Maverick looks up and sees the other two-man team, the victors, waiting on the other side of the net for them. Of course it had to be Ice and Slider.Charlie sits and watches as the game gets immediately out of hand. In moments, Maverick and Ice rotate to forward positions directly opposite each other across the net. Other revelers turn to watch as it degenerates (?) to more than a game. Maverick glances at Charlie. He seems uncomfortable, but irrevocably drawn into the confrontation. She says nothing, but her attitude is apparent. Back to the game: Slider and Goose set them up, as they try to spike the ball in each other's face. The final point...up over the middle. They both go up, Maverick smashes, Ice blocks, but the ball sails away, off his forearm. For the first time ever, Maverick beats him. He looks over at Charlie, she is staring out to sea. She looks back at him and he's suddenly had enough competition. They call for another game, but Maverick turns away...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on, come on! It's double or nothing.. We're talking twelve bucks American, here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've had enough...for now. He grabs Charlie and his gear..
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You want to go ballistic?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know. I don't like being out of control. He looks back at Ice, bouncing the ball and staring at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stick with me, you'll get used to it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .  EXT. DESERT The Bike doing 130, 140, 150 mph. Charlie is unfazed. He turns to check her out, she smiles back at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .  EXT. RUSTIC ADOBE CANTINA - SUNSET The bike is parked in front.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - to show the passage of time...the latticed terrace, streaks of light. Maverick is feeding a dog. Charlie sits on a rail watching him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I always wanted to fly... ever since I first saw a jet. I wanted to fly jets, then I wanted F-14's, then I wanted to fly off carriers, then I wanted Top Gun.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And now?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And now I want you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You always get what you want?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know yet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He puts money in jukebox. She watches him...eye to eye contact. The music comes on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I want it understood.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Anything.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No fooling on base, no signs, no comments, no talk. By anyone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm a professional. You guys are in my line of work. A long beat. He looks at her -- makes the pact: like a sailor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Acknowleged. She looks at his eyes for any sign of a put-on, insincerity. Finally he smiles at her but she can read it. It's time. She moves in and covers his grin with a gentle kiss.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: To them sitting within striking distance at a table. The dog sleeps beneath. Their eyes are now locked. The electricity almost arcs between them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Scrub pine table. Their fingertips touch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Waist to head. Holding, close together, swaying in time with the music. Their lips gently brush.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 61. OMITTED 62.  EXT. DAY - DESERT - TACTS RANGE An F-14 swoops over the desert, ROARS over an antenna complex. The JET.- In it's missile rack, it carries a TACTS transponder. The TACTS Range is an area of the desert completely enveloped by computerized radar. The computers calculate a number of aircraft's positions and velocities by means of transponders in the ships and ground stations that talk to each other thousands of times a second.  Using this system, it is possible to track aerial combat instantaneously and give pilots directions and also to play back the combats for analysis.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .  INT. TACTS RANGE TRAILER - DAY The double viewing screens are five feet high; high technology, state of the art. On the screens are computer animated figures showing jets from various angles. Flight data is displayed. The operators punch buttons to show various points-of-view of the battle: a pilot's p.o.v.; God's p.o.v. from overhead, a long range p.o.v., showing topography of the landscape and height of mountains. Students and instructors sit on chairs in the peanut gallery, facing Viper at the front of the room. Charlie is in the back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The bandit has good position right here. All right, freeze here. The moment of choice -- Maverick is defensive. He has a chance to bug out right here....Better to retire and save your plane than force a bad position. Stay in the diamond another three seconds, the bandit will blow you out of the sky...make a hard right, select zone 5...(turns to Maverick to drive point home) you can extend and escape. You make a bad choice. Roll forward. The computerized rendering resumes on the screen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You perform a split S. That's the last thing you should do. The bandit is right on your tail -- Freeze there...the bandit has you in his gunsight. What were you thinking here, Maverick?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I wasn't thinking. I just did it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Big gamble with a thirty million dollar plane!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (smiling) No guts, no glory. It's a joke. Viper doesn't like that answer at all, but some of the students laugh and mockingly whistle at the cockiness of it. They give Maverick the high sign. Slider leans forward to him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your guts. His glory. Maverick slumps down in his chair under Viper's glare.  The computer rendering rolls forward again. He glances back at Charlie. She smiles sympathetically at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Unfortunately, the gamble worked, or you might have learned something. The bandit never gets a clean shot...Maverick makes an aggressive vertical move here, comes over the top and defeats the bandit with a missile shot. The encounter was a victory, but we've shown it as an example of what not to do. Ice is next. Another computerized rendering comes up on the screen. Hollywood leans close to Maverick and speaks quietly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gutsiest move I ever saw. Maverick gives him a small nod of appreciation.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And the dumbest...Okay, look at this. It's textbook. Ice takes control of the battle immediately. He never gives the bandit a chance to take the offensive. An early turn here -- excellent. He goes for the jugular, and it's over just that quick. Let's run that again, it's exactly how it should be done.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .  through  75B. OMITTED 76.  EXT. MIRAMAR RUNWAY - DAY In full flight gear, carrying their helmets and trying to stuff food down their gullets, the students rush/stumble toward the flight line. Hollywood takes a bit of a sandwich and makes a face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What the hell is this?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't chew it, you won't have it that long. Easier to clean the cockpit if it comes up in big chunks. Jester yells from the distance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: On the run. Let's go. Move it!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A fighter pilot's lunch... a hot dog and a puke. They scurry ahead, overtaking the others. HOLLYWOOD I was a victim of circumstance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They should have warned you about that one.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She's kinky for flight suits--said that she'd never seen so many zippers--played with them all night. The noise alone kept me up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What'd you do?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pulled left, rolled out, underneath.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's kind of ironic. All you guys have women troubles and I don't.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's because you don't have any women.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Until last night. Did you see the moves I was making on that girl at the party?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The girl with the purple fingernails?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's her--tall hungry woman with fire in her eyes. It was great.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It was bad.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bad?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The girl with the purple fingernails was Coogan's sister. They all laugh. Wolfman looks stunned.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Coogan spent half the night looking for her. He said he was gonna kill the son-of-a-bitch who ruined his sister.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I didn't ruin her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You didn't help.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, really. She came ruined!... Ya think he knows it was me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Seemed not to. But it's hard to know. You never can tell what's in the mind of a psychopath. Wolfman looks very unsettled.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hear about Ice?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What now?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He won again. Goose walks beside Maverick now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Something bothering you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nothing. Let's just go fight. Wolfman looks very apprehensive as they approach the F-14's. MECHANICS surround both planes, making last minute checks of all systems. Among them is COOGAN, six and a half feet tall, looking mean. Maverick tosses him a wave.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Morning, Coogan.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How's it goin', Coog?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ever find your sister, Coogan?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You guys know somethin' about that? Wolfman swallows hard and hurries quickly into the plane. Coogan glares at them all with a look that could kill.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .  OMITTED 78.  EXT. F-14'S - DAY Hollywood leads, Maverick follows. They point their noses down and dive. Two bogies fly side by side at five thousand, outlined against the blue Pacific. Smaller, slower, they seem helpless for a moment. We hear the instructors in the F-5's.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: TWO AT SEVEN O'CLOCK, JESTER. SCRAMBLE.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . COMING LEFT.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Holy shit, it's Viper.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Keep your shirt on, he's saying holy shit it's us. The bogies split. Bogey One hard left. Bogey Two hard right. Hollywood sweeps left, pursuing Bogey One. Maverick hangs back to cover him. Bogey One makes a strong vertical move. Hollywood stays on him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... YOUR SIX CLEAR! Bogey One loops and comes down, and Hollywood almost loses him for a moment before regaining the angle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! TIGHTEN YOUR TURN!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bogey at three o'clock high! Nose on! Maverick looks quickly at three o'clock high, sees Bogey Two returning to the fight. He jerks the stick right, and the two planes make a quick pass.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ..MISSED HIM..
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just cover Wood, Maverick. Mutual support, man!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm gonna take him, Goose.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't be greedy. Stay with Wood.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I want him! Maverick goes suddenly vertical, zooms straight up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, come on--hey! Maverick loops the F-14 down to get the quick angle on Viper in Bogey Two. Viper takes off, running from the fight again. Maverick looks over his shoulder and sees that Hollywood still has a good position on Bogey One. He takes a hard right and streaks off after Viper.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What what are you doing? We're cover!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wood's okay. I want Viper. Goose looks back at Hollywood and Bogey One.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But we're cover! Viper streaks across the sky with Maverick close behind. He pushes the throttle forward to ZONE 5 - full afterburner. Viper shows all his tricks...hard left, hard right, rolling into vertical, flipping into a dive. Maverick stays with him. VIPER (To himself) Goddamn, rookie, you're all right!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .  INT. F-14 Maverick turns to get Viper in the diamond. He hears a SIDEWINDER GROWL in his headset.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's the range, Goose. I've got a good tone. Viper jinks but Maverick stays with him.  Viper is in the diamond, and the TONE GOES CRAZY. But suddenly....
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Two bogies ! Three o'clock high, nine o'clock high! Break! They come out of nowhere, flashing down toward Maverick--a crossfire ambush. Maverick's eyes are startled.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . HE'S OUT OF THE FIGHT.. Maverick is stunned. He has been tricked, humiliated. There's a little salt for the wound as Viper and Jester celebrate.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NICE GOING. GOOSE THE DEFENSE DEPARTMENT REGRETS TO INFORM YOU THAT YOUR SONS ARE DEAD BECAUSE THEY WERE STUPID! Slaps his helmet like a dolt...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . LET'S RTB. VIPER HAS THE LEAD.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: JESTER ATOLL ON THE NORTHERN F-14
GOOSE THE DEFENSE DEPARTMENT REGRETS TO INFORM YOU THAT YOUR SONS ARE DEAD BECAUSE THEY WERE STUPID
JESTER NOT ONLY THAT, BUT ZORRO GOT YOUR WINGMAN
VIPER KNOCK OFF THE CHATTER, TOP GUNS

direction.raw_text: .  INT. LOCKER ROOM - DAY Silence. Several pilots in various forms of undress. Maverick and Goose sit with their heads down, a hangdog expression on their faces.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .  INT. DIRTY DAN'S - A BAR - LATER Maverick mopes at the bar, a figure comes up behind him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ya know, that was the best flying I've seen since Nam...(He grins) ...Right up to that part where you got killed. Viper sits down. He's in a jovial, taunting mood.  Maverick watches him guardedly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Twenty years' experience, I couldn't shake you. You may be a great flyer. I mean that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I lost.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Of course you did. I said a great flyer, not a smart one. You fly reckless. Great instincts. No discipline. That ambush today, you followed your emotions instead of your wingman. Of course you got killed...and well deserved to. It was a really stupid mistake. In battle, it gets people killed. Maverick nods and stares at his beer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can take care of myself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Talent is no holy shield. Von Richtofen was killed by a farm boy. Instincts are not enough. Do it our way. We've worked these things out. The good pilots can become better and the great ones can learn how to stay alive.  (he studies him for a moment)  Why do you have to do everything the hard way?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's my own way. It works for me. I don't care about the rest of that stuff.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then why are you here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: For the same reason you are.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, you mean the thrill!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The flying. The fighting.  I'd go up there ten times a day to fight. I'd win at least nine of them. That's all I want to do. It's what I do best. I am real good.  Just give me the jet. Viper studies him,
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's not a gift, just a loan... He finishes his beer, then rises.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nine out of ten is okay, as long as it's only fun and games. But this isn't about that. This is serious business. It is dangerous up there! At 500 knots, things can change a lot in a second. Discipline is what protects us. He signals the bartender and drops some money on the bar. He stretches, looks around. VIPER It was a good day. You learned something. You lost and you're still alive to think about it. And, you lost your wingman. That's a cardinal sin...don't ever do it again. You owe Hollywood an apology and you owe me a beer. Viper touches Maverick's shoulder as he moves away. It was just the gesture Maverick needed, for he seems to relax from his tension. He sips his beer alone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .  INT. SAN DIEGO AIRPORT - NIGHT Maverick and Goose move through the terminal, anxious/expectant looks on their faces.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Relationships are a bitch, here. It's hard enough to concentrate ...under the pressure. Having a woman here is asking for it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I guess that's what I'm doing, then.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where do you find the time? Where do you find the energy. It's tough enough to keep your mind on school. A woman here is a real pain in the... A pretty woman emerges from the crowd and spots them first. She rushes them, happily, carrying her sleepy four-year-old, RICKY. Goose undergoes an immediate change, beaming a big smile that he has practiced on her for years. She sets down the kid.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .  EXT. CLOUD COVER - 20,000 FT. - DAY Four F-14's fly in formation over the Pacific, searching for (MiGs). They spot them, engage. The combatants fly scissor patterns, slashing past each other, angling for position. We hear the VOICES OF COMBAT from the planes, a barrage of information exchanges between pilots and RIO's. Maverick and Ice swoop close together on each other's wing--moving on each other, testing, they glance at each other and nod. The Challenge...the fight is on. Suddenly an F-5 rises up out of the clouds in front of them--Ice has the advantage and rolls in on him.

A HURRICANE OF WIND AND NOISE

direction.raw_text: .  BOOM - A HURRICANE OF WIND AND NOISE The canopy BLASTS away--but is held spinning above the cockpit by the vortex of the sinking jet. Goose glances up at it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's go. Eject. Goose yanks the ejection handle. Things happen in a split second. Goose is fired up and out by the rocket under his seat. Almost instantly he impacts the spinning canopy. A sickening CRUNCH. The canopy is knocked away. Maverick is slammed back in his seat as the ejection seat straps wind up. He is BLASTED out of the plane just before it spins in.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: TIGHT ON MAVERICK AS HE TUMBLES IN SLOW MOTION

direction.raw_text: .  TIGHT ON MAVERICK AS HE TUMBLES IN SLOW MOTION He's in shock..the loud THUMPING of his heart, labored breathing, a scream that stays in his mind. Instinctively, he gropes for straps. He releases the pilot seat, it tumbles away. His chute streams, balloons open, snapping his body like a bullwhip.  He drifts momentarily, then plunges into the sea.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . UNDERWATER His face, distorted in the water; wild eyes, disoriented, choking for air. He reaches out, finds nothing to grab. Suddenly, he is yanked hard to the side.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .  SURFACE The parachute is caught by the wind, and dragged, pulling Maverick along beneath the surface. He is twisting in the water, turning over and over, trying desperately to slip out of the tangled straps. He finally hits the surface of the water and sucks air into his lungs. With the end of his strength, he hits the release snaps and breaks free from the parachute. It whips away like a kite in a typhoon. The sea is choppy and rough. He struggles as his equipment drags him under. He twists, finds the inflatable raft attached to his harness. Maverick pulls the cord, and the raft hisses open. He pulls his body into the six-by-two foot raft and collapses, completely exhausted. The survival has been almost without thinking: an instinctual physical struggle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .  TWILIGHT Maverick begins to focus on the situation. He stains the water with dye, then sees another parachute floating nearby. Paddling to the parachute, he reaches over the side and begins to pull on the heavy cords that are submerged in the water. A great struggle. The weight is extremely heavy. Finally, he pulls a body to the surface. Goose. Goose is dead. Maverick releases the parachute and pulls Goose into the raft on top of him. He holds Goose in his arms. His mind shuts down again. From high above the ocean, we see the debris on the water. An oil slick, pieces of honeycomb titanium, and the small, helpless figure in the raft.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .  EXT. OCEAN - NIGHT Searchlights skim over the black ocean. A brilliant light flashes as Maverick pops a pencil flare. Helicopter blades flick powerfully. The lights of the choppers descend toward the wreckage area, scanning the debris, searching for life. The spotlights find Maverick and Goose in the raft. The draft from the chopper churns the water. A FROGMAN drops from the chopper and hits with a heavy splashes. He surfaces and swims to the raft as a rescue harness is lowered. Maverick watches curiously as he starts to examine Goose. He hugs Goose closer and looks threatened.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let him go, sir. Take it easy. He tries to pry Goose free, but Maverick has a death grip on the body.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sir! Let him go. It's all right. Let him go. Maverick glares at the man as he bobs in the water. Another long moment, then Maverick releases Goose. The frogman quickly straps Maverick into the harness. HIS POV. - He watches the lifeless body in the water as he is pulled up and away. He shivers from the cold.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .  INT. HOSPITAL ROOM - NIGHT Extreme CLOSE ON Maverick's face. He is emotionless. His eyes are flat and absolutely without expression. There is complete silence in the room. Then we hear the quiet, calm, probing voice of Viper.

direction.raw_text: How do you feel?

direction.raw_text: All right.

direction.raw_text: You've got to put him in the box. Maverick is watching Viper, but he doesn't have anything to say.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I love.ove y.you. They embrace madly and sink to the sand. From the distance it looks like a strange slithering creature crawling back to the sea.

direction.raw_text: .  INT. GOOSE'S ROOM - NIGHT The lights are out in Goose's room at the Bachelor Officers' Quarters. The door opens, and Maverick enters. He sets a cardboard box on the bed. Silently, Maverick gathers together Goose's few personal possessions. He fills the box with clothes, books, a clock, a radio, a walkman, and articles from the bathroom. He examines each closely, like an artifact...as if he might find some message or meaning in them. He fumbles them into the box. He can't see too well, his eyes are full of tears. Maverick closes the box and carries it to the door. He takes one last glance around, then leaves and closes the door behind him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .  INT. BOQ RECEPTION AREA                      * Carol and the kid, stand, staring at a silent TV. Carol looks dazed, lost. Maverick walks in, finds her. An awkward silence while they both try to think of something to say. Maverick hands the box to Carol.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .   OMITTED 89B.  CLOSE UP - MAVERICK. He sits staring right through us...the thousand-yard stare. A strange white unreal light washes over him. The only color, the Navy and gold of the stripes on his shoulderboards. A low rumbling mumbling filters through the HISS of surf or fans or something...Snatches of low whispered conversation....disregard of...basic air-safety principles...too aggressive...incident.... 29 July...within performance parameters... disciplinary action...tactical doctrine.... even reckless at times... conjecture...unsupported ...benefit of the doubt... Maverick's eyes slowly focus. The light attenuates. The surrounding image becomes denser. Things become real.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .  INT. CONFERENCE ROOM - DAY - MAVERICK'S POV A BOARD OF INQUIRY, a COMMANDER and other NAVY OFFICERS seated behind tables at the front of the room. Maverick faces them, wearing dress whites. Viper is also present. The Commander looks at each of the Officers. They each nod, in turn, indicating readiness. The Commander turns to Maverick, and states for the record:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Board of Inquiry finds that Lt. Evan Mitchell was not at fault in the accident of twenty-nine July. No response from Maverick, one way or the other. Viper studies his face with concern.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lt. Mitchell's record will be cleared of this incident. Still no response from Maverick.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Lt. Mitchell is restored to flight status without further delay. These proceedings are closed. Maverick doesn't respond.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .  INT. MAVERICK'S ROOM - NIGHT Maverick lies on his bunk and stares at the ceiling. The phone next to his bed is RINGING.  It RINGS EIGHT OR NINE TIMES, then stops. He makes no move to reach for it. 92. through 95. OMITTED 94A.  INT. COCKPIT - F-14 ON FLIGHT LINE Maverick sits in the cockpit staring at the controls while the ground crew preps the aircraft for flight. Coogan helps him strap in. He speaks solicitously to Maverick. It is unheard over the JET NOISE and RADIO BABBLE. Maverick looks at the cockpit as if it's a strange territory, suddenly foreign to him. He grabs the stick like it's some peculiar talisman. He turns and looks aft. He seems surprised that it moves the control surfaces in the tails.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .  EXT. SAN DIEGO AIRPORT - NIGHT Charlie parks her car, jumps out, and runs toward the main entrance to the terminal.

direction.raw_text: .  INT. TERMINAL Charlie hurries through the crowd, bumping past people, searching frantically for Maverick in the huge terminal. She moves past bench after bench, and her eyes flick in all directions. A quick glance at the souvenir shop, the coffee shop, and then she heads for the bar. Maverick is there, sitting alone in a booth with his suitcase beside him, staring into a drink. Charlie composes herself, then walks to the booth and sits down across the table from him. Maverick does not look pleased.

direction.raw_text: I've got a gift just like you do. My gift is I just know what people mean, even if they can't say it. It helps when you're trying to communicate with fighter pilots. Like what you just said was "I'm embarrassed, I feel I've done something wrong, that I've failed, and I don't think I can live up to the expectations of a wonderful interesting, intelligent woman like yourself." That about it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (laughs) ...Something like that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And I'm gonna sneak off, and be by myself for awhile, like until I can think of a new career...hotel management or something...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Big talk for someone who's never been shot off her computer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, I never said I was a fighter pilot...I never claimed to think it was fun to be shot off the end of a ship in a storm. I can find contentment in a good book. I don't have to roar by someone at Mach two with my hair on fire. Sometimes...I just get happy being with the right man.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I hope you find him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think I have... I could be wrong. I have been before. Just remember one thing. If you're not Top Gun, if you're not fighting jets, you're not gonna be able to act like a fighter pilot... You're gonna have to act like the rest of us. You're gonna have to master humility. For you guys, that's the toughest maneuver of all. She gets up...lays a bill out for the drinks...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So long, Sailor. See you on the beach sometime. She swings away. Her wake sucks in the stares of every man in the place. Then they look over to Maverick, quick flicks of envy in their eyes. He stares them back and can't quite meet their eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .  EXT. BEACH AT VIPER'S HOUSE - LATER Viper is tugged down the beach by a three year old kid. They come across one creature who's had a bad night...Viper spots him, he spots Viper, and Viper moves toward him. Tim, Viper's kid, wants to head for the sea and pulls his father in that direction. He stops, puts his hand on his hips like he's seen the pilots do. TIM Dad...Of all the aminals in the ocean, which one's the baddest?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know, Tim. You'll have to ask them. Viper turns to the creature, Maverick, and shrugs.

direction.raw_text: Runs in the family... Maverick stands up. MAVERICK Skipper, sorry to bother you.

direction.raw_text: No bother.

direction.raw_text: I called your house.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My wife's house.

direction.raw_text: She said you took your kid to the each. Every second Sunday. Zoo or beach or the ballgame. Y'have the option...(Maverick thinks for a beat. Segues to the question...) What about me? Viper turns, they stroll together.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We can send you back to your squadron with nothing noted on your record except "CNC" --course not completed, no explanation required. Theoretically, it doesn't hurt your career, but people always wonder about things like that.

direction.raw_text: Or you can quit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know...

direction.raw_text: I didn't know either. That's why I told Jester to prepare your papers. Maverick looks irritated. Viper stops at an icecream vendor and orders three with a gesture.

direction.raw_text: You've already made up your mind.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's no disgrace, kid. That spin was hell. It would wreck anyone's confidence. You could be a good pilot again someday...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (starts to get his back up) You think I should quit?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I didn't say that. That's up to you. But I have responsibility for the other guys up there, not just you. They need to know you're all right...that they can depend on you. The vendor hands them icecream, they take it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Here, let me get this. We'll be even. He reaches into his pocket for change, comes out with a handful. Slams it on the counter, stars picking the proper change out. Viper spots something and reaches for it...Maverick sees and tries to block it, but Viper comes up with the Navy Cross.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lucky charm. But Viper recognizes it for what it is.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sometimes it's luck, but in this case, he earned it... I served with your old man.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: the Oriskany. You remind me of him. You're just like he was, only better...and worse.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm nothing like him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You may not think so, but you are.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He was by the book, all the way.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They waved him off. He thought he knew better. He hit the ramp.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I never heard that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not something they tell dependents.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's not true. Viper looks at him, for a long beat, throws his icecream away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why would I lie? He turns, walks away. Maverick stands there for a moment, thinking, then catches up to him, stops him...struggles with the thought...as Viper breaks in...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You start on a wrong heading... the more you stick to it, the further you get from your target. A good pilot always questions himself, always questions his judgments, stays alert for drift and makes the corrections...You may find a little discipline helps with the fear. You don't have to be alone up there. A pause...quiet intensity.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How can I go on? I feel so... responsible.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kid, the plain fact is...you are. I'm not gonna stand here and blow sunshine up your ass. Technically, they absolved you. You and I know what really happened. You pushed it. You are responsible and you'll always carry that. You know what, I'll carry it too. I should have taken you out of that cockpit. I guess I'm a hopeless romantic... I always try to find something worthwhile in someone's death. It's no trade-off. It's not one for one. What you learned isn't worth his death. It couldn't be. But maybe there is some value in it. I know it's the first thing I've ever seen that's really gotten to you. Now the question is, what will you do with it. If it gets you out of flight status...so you don't kill yourself or anybody else...that's good. That's one good thing. You were an accident waiting to happen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You think I shouldn't fly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I didn't say that. That's up to you. I think that if you do, if you choose to come back, you'll be a better pilot... a better man.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Would you take me back? Would they?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll have to think about it. I don't know about them. I do know one thing, We've got a lot invested in you. We'd hate to lose it. Even more than those other guys, Naval Aviation needs a very few, very good men.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good to see you, man. One by one, they come over, shake his hand. Viper stands there, looking pleased but gruff. Maverick walks over, shakes his hand. The party starts to pick up. A real celebration, now. Jester enters, a sheaf of messages in his hand. He takes Viper aside for a word. Viper nods at him. The group's attention gradually swings onto them. They quiet down instinctively. Viper finally turns to them.

direction.raw_text: You're on your way. Don't bother going to BOQ. Your bags are packed. He hands them orders. Someone turns the music back up... as they shake hands all around, the music grows, becomes purer as the background voices drop out. 115A.  TIGHT ON MAVERICK'S EYES WIDEN OUT - To include his helmet. Stereo headphones from his walkman carry the same music from the party as he sits in the cockpit and stares at the grey water rushing under. He sits in his Tomcat on Ready 5 Alert. In the back, Fungus plays a hand computer game - Jet Attack.

direction.raw_text: Is there something I should know?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just relax.
direction.name: direction

direction.name: direction

direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is it you?

direction.raw_text: Yeah, I guess it is. We did it! We did it...Damn! We sure did it!

direction.raw_text: I know. I know....Aw hell, let's do it!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .  PRI-FLY BRIDGE - (Primary Flight Control)  USS KITTY HAWK The Air Boss speaks to Maverick over the UHF. The Admiral, the XO and other officers watch and listen.

direction.raw_text: . REQUEST A FLYBY FOR TWO.

direction.raw_text: Mitchell...

direction.raw_text: (surpressing a grin) ...Likes to break at 600, 'stead of 300 knots. The Air Boss hates him. One time, he came over the deck at two hundred, shakes the shit out of the bridge. Lifted Johnson right off his feet.

direction.raw_text: .  INT. MAVERICK'S F-14 He glances over at Ice, who gives him thumbs up.

direction.raw_text: Give him his flyby. The Admiral looks at the others, tries to surpress his own grin. He slides into his (borrowed) command chair, looks into the wind. On the back of the chair, a clue; his name and rank:  RADM. Buford Clancy, "BOOMER" The AIR BOSS burns, but has no choice. AIR BOSS (really pissed off)
direction.name: direction

result.heading: AIR BOSS MUSTANG TO GHOST RIDER

direction.raw_text: .  EXT. KITTY HAWK DAY Sailors line the deck and search the sky. They crane their necks from their battle stations, sweating into the sun, watching for the approach of F-14's. Someone sees it--he points and SHOUTS. The F-14 appears, and every man stands and CHEERS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . POV - WE COME SCREAMING IN, 5 FEET OVER THE WATER, throwing up rooster tails behind. WE SPLIT OFF and ZOOM along each side of the carrier, at 100 feet and ROLL IT.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .  INT. PRI-FLY BRIDGE--VVVAAAAABBOOOOM! It lifts the Air Boss right off his feet. The walls warp, dust sifts from the overhead. The whole tower just goes BOOM!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Goddamn that guy!"
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .  EXT. FLIGHT DECK They break at 500 knots. Ice is first down over the ramp, waved in.  The F-14 comes in a little rocky. It bounces hard but grabs the wire, then jerks to a sudden halt. The sailors CHEER AND APPLAUD, throwing fists of victory into the air, straining to get a look at Ice as the crew directs his plane off to the side. Opening the canopy, Ice and Slider unstrap. Stinger and the others are there. Guys are climbing up, climbing all over the airplane. They're already painting a MiG on the side, and they're looking at Ice in awe.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .  POV - MAVERICK - THROUGH THE WINDSHIELD - AS HE LANDS He catches the wire, the view slams down toward the deck as the plane arrests, then comes up...He releases the cockpit and can hear the ROAR OF THE CROWD...
direction.name: direction

result.heading: ENGINES AS THE GROUND CREW SWARMS

direction.raw_text: .  EXT. FLIGHT DECK He swings the nose around past Ice's. Ice's plane is covered in colored jerseys as the ground crew pulls him out. Maverick's plane swings towards the PRI-FLY BRIDGE. Pilots in flightsuits pour from the deck hatch APPLAUDING... 137.  HE CUTS HIS ENGINES AS THE GROUND CREW SWARMS As Maverick and Fungus climb down, they see their wingmen on the deck. Ice is looking in Maverick's direction. His face is inscrutable. Maverick gets mobbed, but pushes over to Ice. They stare at each other for a moment, eye to eye even as they are buffeted by the crowd. Finally, Ice breaks...a grin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I guess I owe you one.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You don't owe me anything. We're on the same team. ICE You saved our lives. You did it! MAVERICK We did it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're a hell of a flyer. (he can't resist) You can be my wingman any time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (laughs) No. You can be mine! Now Ice laughs. Nobody's ever gonna win on this one. But Ice smiles at him...It's now a running joke between them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Whatever you say, Commander. He and Slider snap to and proudly salute. Maverick hesitates, then returns it. As Ice and Slider snap it off, it turns into the pilot's salute, they give them the bird. Maverick and Fungus laugh and return the compliment. As they are mobbed by sailors, Maverick is elated to see two familiar figures: Hollywood and Wolfman turn from their battle damaged TOMCAT on the forward elevator as it sinks out of sight below decks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .  EXT. FLIGHT DECK FUNGUS What happened to you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He got our radio, and an engine. We were lucky to make it back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not luck. Skill.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stinger rushes up, grabs Ice and Maverick in a bear hug.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: MiG killers! You name it, boy. Sky's the limit. You name it. A medal. Anything you want. Anything.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: MiG killers!  What else is there? Maverick grins, turns away from them.  He he looks out, at the dying sun glinting over the sea. He thinks how beautiful it is out here! Fungus grabs him from behind.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You hear that? Anything we want. Anything...Well???
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well what?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you want?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do I want?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you want?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (he thinks.) Any more MiGs? Stinger shakes his head no.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They don't seem to want to come up anymore. There's nothing on the scopes. In fact, everybody's denying the incident ever happened. So...what is it?  What do you want? Maverick turns away, considering the options.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .  EXT. FLIGHT DECK - ANOTHER ANGLE Another Tomcat rolls up to park nearby. He looks at the plane. Over the deck LOUDSPEAKER, comes the final call to the F-14:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (a touch of sarcasm)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . YOU CAN CUT YOUR ENGINES...YOU HAVE ARRIVED....

result.heading: AS THE ENGINES FADE, SO DOES THE PICTURE

direction.raw_text: - WEEKS LATER 140.  EXT. DAY - FLIGHT LINE MIRAMAR - TOPGUN Viper, Jester and others walk out of hangar to watch a wing return.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .  EXT. MIRAMAR RUNWAY - DAY THEIR POV. Suddenly an F-14 breaks, ROARS in over the field inverted, a hundred feet off the ground.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .  FLIGHT LINE MIRAMAR - DAY JESTER Who's the hell is that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Three guesses.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, he's in trouble and he didn't even get here yet. Jester looks over at an admiral, who steps out of a staff car, squints up at the swooping plane, turns, barks an order to his driver, jumps in the car and SLAMS the door, the car takes off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .  EXT. MIRAMAR RUNWAY - DAY - FURTHER DOWN THE RUNWAY MP jeeps - lights flashing, pull out and head for the flight line.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on. They head for the hangar
direction.name: direction

result.heading: OVER THE END OF THE RUNWAY

direction.raw_text: .  OVER THE END OF THE RUNWAY The jet breaks at 500 knots and sets down neatly on the tarmac. The rest of his flight follows in perfect formation.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .  EXT. MIRAMAR RUNWAY - DAY - MAVERICK'S JET -PULLING UP He unbuckles his straps, takes his helmet off. He looks over at the approaching caravan.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think they know we're here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let me do the talking.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, no. You did the flying, I'll do the talking! He stands up in the cockpit, gives a snappy salute.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why Admiral....How really good it is to see you! Maverick turns away. As he backs down the steps, a jeep screeches up, doors slam open, footsteps.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who's in charge here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I am. He's answered automatically, but now it hits him. He knows the voice. He turns.
direction.name: direction
